==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|人|弋|alt1=亻|c1=s|c2=p|t1=person|ls=psc}}.

弋 and 代 were near-homophones in Old Chinese; [http://lodel.ehess.fr/crlao/document.php?id=1217 Baxter-Sagart] give *[[w:International Phonetic Alphabet|lək]] for 弋 and *[[w:International Phonetic Alphabet|lˤək-s]] for 代 (the -s is a suffix). See also [[式]].
